section.title: What is KaarPux?
section.para: &kx; is a Linux distribution, where everything is build (automatically) from source. See e.g.
&kx; is aimed at developers who want to build and explore a Linux distribution, where they have complete control over the build process.

&kx; features:
Linux 3 kernel
GNU build system and tools; gcc compiler
X.Org X11 server
GNOME 3 desktop environment
Mozilla Firefox Web Browser and Thunderbird Mail
IcedTea Java based on OpenJDK
Libre Office personal productivity suite
And 600 other software packages
The bootstrap part of &kx; is based on Linux From Scratch, but fully automated.

Known limitations:
&kx; is not (yet) a multilib system, so xen and skype will not build on a x86_64 (64-bit) platform.
No specific support for laptops.
